t: Matthew 28
In*p the end of the sabbath, as it began to dawn toward the first day of the week, came Mary Magdalene and the other Mary to see the sepulchre.
And,*p behold, there was a great earthquake: for the angel of the Lord descended from heaven, and came and rolled back the stone from the door, and sat upon it.
His*p countenance was like lightning, and his raiment white as snow:
And*p for fear of him the keepers did shake, and became as dead men.
And*p the angel answered and said unto the women, Fear not ye: for I know that ye seek Jesus, which was crucified.
He*p is not here: for he is risen, as he said. Come, see the place where the Lord lay.
And*p go quickly, and tell his disciples that he is risen from the dead; and, behold, he goeth before you into Galilee; there shall ye see him: lo, I have told you.
And*p they departed quickly from the sepulchre with fear and great joy; and did run to bring his disciples word.
And*p as they went to tell his disciples, behold, Jesus met them, saying, All*r hail.*r And they came and held him by the feet, and worshipped him.
Then*p said Jesus unto them, Be*r not*r afraid:*r go*r tell*r my*r brethren*r that*r they*r go*r into*r Galilee,*r and*r there*r shall*r they*r see*r me.*r
Now*p when they were going, behold, some of the watch came into the city, and shewed unto the chief priests all the things that were done.
And*p when they were assembled with the elders, and had taken counsel, they gave large money unto the soldiers,
Saying,*p Say ye, His disciples came by night, and stole him away while we slept.
And*p if this come to the governor's ears, we will persuade him, and secure you.
So*p they took the money, and did as they were taught: and this saying is commonly reported among the Jews until this day.
Then*p the eleven disciples went away into Galilee, into a mountain where Jesus had appointed them.
And*p when they saw him, they worshipped him: but some doubted.
And*p Jesus came and spake unto them, saying, All*r power*r is*r given*r unto*r me*r in*r heaven*r and*r in*r earth.*r
Go*rp ye*r therefore,*r and*r teach*r all*r nations,*r baptizing*r them*r in*r the*r name*r of*r the*r Father,*r and*r of*r the*r Son,*r and*r of*r the*r Holy*r Ghost:*r
Teaching*rp them*r to*r observe*r all*r things*r whatsoever*r I*r have*r commanded*r you:*r and,*r lo,*r I*r am*r with*r you*r alway,*r even*r unto*r the*r end*r of*r the*r world.*r Amen.*r
